Description.val:
The OPN 5661 line procures, installs and delivers training devices at the seven schoolhouses worldwide.  These funds support Hull, Mechanical, and Electrical (HM&E), Navigation and Combat Control System training requirements, training upgrades and engineering sustainment for the Submarine Weapon Systems.  Training devices develop system operation and seamanship skills to submarine crews utilized in all submarine mission sets. Funding includes modernization of training devices to maintain compatibility with existing fleet operational equipment and to implement Trainer Enhancement Changes (TECs) as directed by the Fleet Type Commanders and Resource Sponsor (N97).  Funding also includes procurement of training infrastructure and devices at Portsmouth Naval Shipyard for fundamental skills required for crew certification and proficiencies during extended maintenance periods.


Line item 5661 is broken into five functional areas to support submarine training:  Hull Mechanical & Electrical Trainers (HM&E), Engineering Trainers, Navigation Trainers, Combat Control Acoustic Trainers and Attack Center Trainers.

[P40A / Submarine Training]: This line provides funds to procure and modernize training devices to keep them compatible with Fleet operational equipment and to implement Training Enhancement Changes (TECs) to the training systems.

[P40A / TD 100 HM&E TRAINERS]: This line procures HM&E Fleet and Team Trainer Technical Training Equipment (TTE), Training Devices and Training Enhancement Changes (TECs), which are centrally managed systems, support equipment and modifications to simulators such as: Submarine Ship Control Operator Trainer (SCOT), Virginia Submarine Ship Control Operator Trainer (VSCOT) and Firefighter Trainer (FFT). Technical Training Equipment/Training Devices sustain high fidelity training and replaces equipment beyond economical repair or procures new equipment.  Funds also procure Submarine High Risk Trainer subsystems to meet requirements for Pressurized Submarine Escape Trainers and Damage Control Wet Trainers.  This line also provides configuration changes for the Submarine Multipurpose Reconfigurable Training System (MRTS). The MRTS family includes VA CLASS Torpedo Room, Emergency Diesel Generator, Weapons Launch Console Team Trainer, and Common Submarine Radio Room (CSRR) trainers. FY 20 added a one time increase of $5M for Integrated Training and
Maintenance Support Systems (Issue #77277).

[P40A / TD200 ENGINEERING TRAINERS]: This line procures and installs Nuclear Propulsion Plant Fleet Interactive Display Equipment (FIDE) trainers, Virtual Interactive Display Equipment (VIDE), Training Enhancement Changes (TECs), Multipurpose Reconfigurable Training Systems and other Navy Engineering Training devices as identified by the Submarine Learning Center (SLC) and approved by the Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) for use at the submarine training activities. FIDEs/VIDEs support multiple ship classes and configurations at seven different geographic sites and Portsmouth Naval Shipyard, each requiring different levels of installation work. FIDE and VIDE are required by NAVSEA 08 to provide advanced shore-based nuclear operator training.

[P40A / TD 300 NAVIGATION TRAINERS]: Navigation Safety of Ship Trainer line procures Submarine Fleet and Team Navigation trainer equipment and systems which emulate ship characteristics. Navigation training systems include, but are not limited to:  Virtual Environment Submarine (VESUB), Submarine Piloting and Navigation Trainers (SPAN), Reconfigurable SPAN (RSPAN), Submarine Bridge Trainer/Integrated SPAN (SBT/ISPAN) and associated upgrades to all Homeports, Navigation Databases, Periscope Simulation (PSIM), Harbor Databases, Electronic Chart Display and Information Systems-Navy (ECDIS-N) and PC-based Team Trainers including Mini-SPANs. Single Story Bridge Trainers will be procured for Homeports where an SBT Dome MILCON cannot be accommodated.   The SBT/ISPAN is comprised of Virtual Tactical, Beam Forming Sonar Simulation Trainer, Voyage Management System (VMS), ECDIS-N, Radar Simulation, Navigation Aids, Periscope Simulation (PSIM), and Harbor Databases. These training systems and Training Enhancement Changes (TECs) are identified by the Submarine Learning Center (SLC) and approved by the Fleet Type Commanders, for use at the submarine training activities.

[P40A / TD 400 COMBAT CONTROL ACOUSTIC TRAINERS]: This line procures Submarine Common Operational Analysis and Employment Trainer (COAET) fundamental and employment skill level, Sonar Employment Trainer (SET) and Beam Forming Sonar Simulation Trainers (BSST).  These trainers provide the acoustic operator employment skills and team training for fleet requirements.  Funds also provide for TECs, Virtualized Tactical Control (VTAC), Periscope Simulation (PSIM), Submarine Skills Network (SUBSKILLSNET), Weapons Control, Mission Payload Control, Advanced Processing Build (APB)/ Technical Insertion (TI),and Sonar Tactical Decision Aid (STDA) implementation.  The Sonar Employment Trainer (SET) provides acoustic operator employment Fleet and team training for submarine sonar systems.  SET is used to train advanced operators in the Advanced Sonar Employment and Sonar Supervisor courses.  The SET is periodically upgraded to support current software Advanced Processor Builds (APBs) and Technical Insertions (TIs).  The BSST is a light weight, medium fidelity sonar operator trainer for journeyman level training. COAET provides operator and introductory team training to submarine force personnel prior to entry into the Submarine Multi Mission Team Trainer (SMMTT) as well as supplemental training to off-load the heavily utilized submarine attack center trainers.  COAET utilizes partial tactical builds and emulations of the latest Sonar, Combat Control, Imaging and Electronic Warfare Systems which provide an environment substantially equivalent to that found on board ship, thus enabling students to develop and maintain the attack center expertise necessary to support Fleet operations.  COAET supports individual operator/pipeline training at NAVSUBSCOL and fleet responsive training at all other fleet training sites.

[P40A / TD 500 ATTACK CENTER TRAINERS]: The SUBMARINE MULTI MISSION TEAM TRAINER (SMMTT) line procures shore based Combat System Team Trainers capable of training personnel in all aspects of submarine approach, attack and surveillance operations in a controlled, simulated environment to achieve submarine force readiness levels.  The program is required to match the shore based configuration to the fleet modernized Hardware/Software(HW/SW) tactical builds.  This includes the required capability to connect Attack Center to Attack Center for dual crew training and blue on blue or blue on red as directed by the fleet and the Aggressor Squadron.  The SMMTT trainer supports operator, employment, strike, and Battle Group training for enlisted and officer pipelines for these systems and provides operators and combat teams the opportunity to train ashore prior to and between deployments and is also used for SSN/SSGN/SSBN crew certification. SMMTT integrates the Combat Control system (CCS) AN BYG-1 and Acoustic Rapid Cots Insertion (ARCI) AN/BQQ-10 tactical hardware and software builds with the All World Environment Simulation to provide realistic simulation using Authorized Navy databases and programs. This line includes modifications to the functionality of the Periscope Simulator (PSIM) to provide common imaging training for submarine attack centers.  This line also procures Electronic Surveillance Simulation Software.  Submarine attack centers support real world recorded sensor data for playback in the training environment. This line also includes Engineering Production Model (EPM) to manage the additional TI/APB and Trainer Enhancement requirements as directed by the TYCOM.  Also, funding is included for Trainer Enhancement Changes (TECs) as identified by the Submarine Learning Center and approved by the Fleet Type Commanders for use at Submarine Training activities.

[P3A / Submarine Attack Center Modifications]: Submarine Attack Center Modifications line upgrades hardware, software and simulation to match current Fleet configurations.

Justification.val:
The budget provided in FY2021 was reduced to support Undersea Warfare priorities.  The budget will allow us to meet fleet training needs and keep simulators aligned to the Submarine Modernization plan in each Homeport.  Trainer modernization must occur to match the fleet operating systems with the shore-based operating systems to ensure submarine crews are training ashore on the identical system that will be deployed.  Negative training will result if training system is not matched to the shipboard system.  Shore-based trainers are required for Fleet Certification and Pre-Deployment training and must match the tactical and payload configurations.  FY2021 adds funding to provide Navigation Safety of Ship trainers for the SSBN Homeports.

TD100 HME TRAINERS -

1.1 HIGH RISK TRAINERS - Consolidates all similar procurements for High Risk Trainers in FY2021. Procures VA Class Hull Mechanical Electrical Training devices including integrated low-pressure electrolyzer and VA Class Block IV Torpedo Room.

1.3 VA CLASS HME NORFOLK - Combined with 1.1 in FY2021 to add VA Class trainers to the High-Risk training portfolio.

1.4 SUBMARINE TRAINING DEVICES - Funding in FY2021 to procure hydraulic components for the Submarine Hydraulics Maintenance course.  Additionally, this line procures Multi-Reconfigurable Training System software engineering to support Fairbanks Morse Diesel Advanced Scenarios as required by the Fleet Diesel Red Team.

1.5 SHIP CONTROL TRAINERS - Consolidates all similar procurements for Ship Control Operator Trainers (SCOT/VSCOT).  FY2021 procures two 688i Motion System tech refreshes.

1.6 SCOT MODS - Combined with 1.5 in FY2021 to consolidate SSBN and 688 Ship Control trainers.

1.7 VSCOT MODS - Combined with 1.5 in FY2021 to consolidate VA Class Ship Control trainers.

1.8 INTEGRATED TRAINING AND MAINTENANCE SUPPORT SYSTEMS - FY2020 added a one time increase of $5M for Integrated Training and Maintenance Support Systems (Issue #77277).

TD200 ENGINEERING TRAINERS - 

2.3  CURRICULA AND TRAINING MATERIALS - Funding in FY2021 procures training materials and curricula required to teach basic and advanced nuclear power maintenance training. 

TD300 NAVIGATION TRAINERS - 

3.1 NAVIGATION SAFETY OF SHIP TRAINERS - Consolidates in FY2021 all similar procurements for Navigation Trainers. 

3.2 SSBN SAFETY OF SHIP TRAINERS - FY2021 adds funding to provide two Safety of Ship trainers for the SSBN Homeports at a total cost of 4,641K.  This is a new requirement that was established from the comprehensive review in FY2018 as a result of two Naval Warships colliding with merchants at sea resulting in damage to government property and 17 causalities at sea.  

3.3 SUBMARINE BRIDGE TRAINER (SBT)/INTEGREATED SUBMARINE PILOTING AND NAVIGATION (ISPAN) - Combined with 3.1 in FY2021.

3.4 NAVIGATION TRAINER UPDATES - Combined with 3.5 in FY2021 to include Navigation Trainer updates with engineering support.

3.5 ENGINEERING SUPPORT - This line procures two Submarine Navigation Display equipment suites and associated computer hardware and software.  VMS 9.5 will be procured and included in all Navigation trainers. VESUB will be tech refreshed for headsets and graphics computers.  Consolidates VMS, VESUB and NAVIGATION TRAINER UPDATES lines in FY2021. Procurement directly supports Comprehensive Review Navigation Trainer Requirements.

TD400 COMBAT CONTROL ACOUSTIC TRAINERS -

4.1 FLEET RESPONSIVE TEAM TRAINERS - Consolidates all similar procurements in FY2021 for Combat Systems and Acoustic Team Trainers.  FY2021 procures three Common Operator Analysis Employment Trainer (COAET) and one Sonar Employment Trainer (SET) to support officer and enlisted pipeline training and Fleet responsive training across the training domain. 

4.2 SET - Combined with 4.1 in FY2021 to add SET to the Fleet responsive team trainer portfolio.

4.3 COAET Modifications - Combined with 4.1 in FY2021 to add COAET to the Fleet responsive team trainer portfolio.

TD500 ATTACK CENTER TRAINERS - 

5.1 SUBMARINE ATTACK CENTERS - Consolidates in FY2021 all similar procurements for Submarine Attack Center Trainers.  FY2021 procures four Submarine Attack Centers to support pre-deployment and crew certification training ashore.  Trainers are critical to Fleet readiness to ensure warfighter trains ashore with the modernized combat, payload, acoustic, imaging, and electronic warfare systems.  

5.2 SSBN,SSGN,SSN EPM - Consolidates all similar procurements for Engineering Production Models at the Warfare Center.  This effort is critical for trainer lifecycle support, engineering changes and updates without disruption of training at the Submarine Learning sites.  Includes 688, VA, SSGN and SSBN EPMs.  FY2021 procures one EPM.

5.3 SSBN Submarine Multi-Mission Team Trainer (SMMTT) - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include SSBN SMMTT into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.4 SSN SMMTT Tailored 2/4 Model - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include SSN SMMTT Tailored 2/4 Model into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.5 SSN SMMTT EPM - Combined with 5.2 in FY2021 to include SSN SMMTT EPM into SSBN, SSGN, SSN EPM portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.6 VA SMMTT New Normal HW - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include VA SMMTT HW into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.8 VA SMMTT EPM - Combined with 5.2 in FY2021 to include VA SMMTT EPM into SSBN, SSGN, SSN EPM portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.9 SSGN SMMTT HW - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include SSGN SMMTT HW into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.
 
5.10 SSGN SMMTT SW MODS - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include SSGN SMMTT SW MODS into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

5.11 SMMTT TECH SUPPORT - Funding decreases in FY2021 due to efficiencies realized through server virtualization and sun setting of legacy acoustic simulation tools.  New submarine attack centers require less engineering support for software updates/rebuilding of servers.

5.12 SENSOR SIMULATION - Combined with 5.1 in FY2021 to include SENSOR SIMULATION into the Submarine attack center portfolio to include Development Security Operations (DEVSECOPS) acquisition and architecture.

Name.@footnote: 1.1 High Risk Trainers - Procures two MRTS 3D trainers beginning in FY2021; VA Class Hull Mechanical Electrical Training devices including integrated low-pressure electrolyzer and VA Class Block IV Torpedo Room.  This line combines all High Risk Training efforts (1.2 Firefighting Trainer, 1.3 VA Class HME Norfolk) beginning in FY2021.

1.4 Submarine Training Devices - FY2021 procures hydraulic components for the Submarine Hydraulics Maintenance course and Multi-Reconfigurable Training System software engineering to support Fairbanks Morse Diesel Advanced Scenarios as required by the Fleet Diesel Red Team.
1.5 Ship Control Trainers - This line combines all Ship Control Training efforts including 1.6 SCOT MODS and 1.7 VSCOT  MODS starting in FY2021.  Procures two 688i Motion System tech refreshes.

Name.val: 1.8) INTEGRATED TRAINING AND MAINTENANCE SUPPORT SYSTEM

Name.@footnote: 2.1 FIDE - procures training laboratories and training devices required to support FIDE training. Includes site survey, site preparation, modernization and trainer delivery for S6G, S8G, S9G, A4W, A1B and CVN77 Nuclear Power Operator Trainers for FIDEs.

2.2 VIDE procures training laboratories and training devices required to support FIDE/VIDE training. Includes site survey, site preparation, modernization and trainer delivery for S6G, S8G, S9G, A4W, A1B and CVN77 Nuclear Power Operator Trainers for VIDEs.

3.1 Navigation Safety of Ship Trainers- this line combines all navigation training efforts (3.2 SBT/ISPAN) and procures the complete Navigation Safety of Ship Trainers consisting of control and server rooms. This procurement improves projector fidelity and reliability to extend trainer lifespan.

3.2 SSBN Safety of Ship Trainers - FY2021 adds funding to provide Navigation Safety of Ship trainers for the SSBN Homeports at a quantity of two trainers at a total cost of 4,641K.  This is a new requirement that was established from the comprehensive review in FY2018 as a result of two Naval Warships colliding with merchants at sea resulting in damage to government property and 17 casualties at sea. SSBN trainers cost less per kit than 688/VA kits.

3.5 ENGINEERING SUPPORT- This line procures two Submarine Navigation Display equipment suites and associated computer hardware and software.  VMS 9.5 will be procured and included in all Navigation trainers. VESUB will be tech refreshed for headsets and graphics computers.  Consolidates VMS, VESUB and NAVIGATION TRAINER UPDATES lines in FY2021. Procurement directly supports Comprehensive Review Navigation Trainer Requirements.

4.1 Fleet Responsive Team Trainers - this line combines all Combat Control and Acoustic Training efforts (4.2 SET and 4.3 COAET Modifications ) and will provide individual and watch team training on a lower fidelity training device than the Submarine Attack Centers. Trainers include Common Operation Acoustic Employment Trainers (COAET), Sonar Employment Trainers (SET) and other related virtualized training devices.

5.1 Submarine Attack Centers- This line combines all submarine attack center modernization related efforts (5.3 SSBN SMMTT, 5.4 SSN SMMTT Tailored 2/4 Model, 5.6 VA SMMTT New Normal HW, 5.7 VA SMMTT New Normal SW MODS, 5.9 SSGN SMMTT HW, 5.10 SSGN SMMTT SW MODS) in FY2021 to include all procurements related to TI/APB modernization hardware and software for SSN/SSBN/SSGN submarine attack centers. One attack center per quarter will be assembled and delivered per the fleet modernization plan. These deliveries will include updates to match trainer configuration with fleet configuration to enable new capabilities for VA CLASS submarines and will provide 688 Class Submarines with modernized attack center capabilities during crew and pre-deployment certifications ashore.

5.2 SSBN, SSGN, SSN EPM - this line combines all Engineering Production Models (EPMs) (5.5 SSN SMMTT EPM and 5.8 VA SMMTT EPM) required for Submarine Attack Center hardware and software integration and testing.

5.11 SMMTT TECH Support-  Funding decreases in FY2021 due to efficiencies realized through server virtualization and sun setting of legacy acoustic simulation tools.  Requires less labor and engineering support.

Model.val: Submarine Attack Center Modifications supporting SMMTT procurements and deliveries.

Name.@footnote: NSWC CD & NUWC NPT are collaborating warfare centers that manage and execute the SMMTT as directed by NAVSEA.  Both warfare centers function as a prime for this effort.  However, for cost efficiency purposes, they compete their cognizant tasks among multiple vendors with multiple orders to provide equipment/software in a timely manner to meet the fleet required training dates.  As such, the SMMTT delivery is not linked to any single contract date.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Submarine Attack Center Modifications

Description.val: Submarine Attack Center Modifications line upgrades hardware, software and simulation to match current Fleet configurations.
